Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards.leaderCards

Class LeaderCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards.Card
it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards.leaderCards.LeaderCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
CardView
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdditionalProductionPowerCard, DiscountCard, ExtraDepotCard, WhiteConversionCard
public abstract class LeaderCard
extends Card
LeaderCard is one of 16 cards created at the beginning by Game. It has 4 standard methods which will be @Override by the specific inherited card.

  • Constructor Details

    • LeaderCard

      public LeaderCard​(Resource resource, Cost resourceCost, int victoryPoints, int cardID)
      Parameters:
      resource - stands for the effect resource of this card.
      resourceCost - stands for the resources required to activate the card.
      victoryPoints - stands for the victory given by activating this card.
      cardID - is the cardID. active is initialized at false.

    • LeaderCard

      public LeaderCard​(Resource resource, LeaderRequirements leaderRequirements, int victoryPoints, int cardID)
      Parameters:
      resource - stands for the effect resource of this card.
      leaderRequirements - stands for the resources required to activate the card.
      victoryPoints - stands for the victory given by activating this card.
      cardID - is the cardID. active is initialized at false.

  • Method Details

    • getResource

      public Resource getResource()

    • getVictoryPoints

      public int getVictoryPoints()
      Overrides:
      getVictoryPoints in class Card
      Returns:
      0 if LeaderCard is not active, otherwise @return its victory points.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()

    • activateCard

      public boolean activateCard​(Warehouse w, Strongbox s, LeaderRequirements l) throws InsufficientResourceException, InsufficientCardsException, ActiveLeaderCardException
      Parameters:
      w - is player's warehouse.
      s - is player's strongbox.
      l - summarizes player's development cards.
      Throws:
      InsufficientResourceException - if player has not enough resources.
      InsufficientCardsException - if player has not enough cards. this method only evaluates if player has enough resources or enough cards, based on leaderCard requirement, without doing anything.
      ActiveLeaderCardException

    • additionalProductionPower

      public int additionalProductionPower​(Warehouse w, Strongbox s, int choice, Resource resource) throws InsufficientResourceException, NoSuchProductionPowerException
      Parameters:
      w - is player's warehouse.
      s - is player's strongbox.
      choice - is player's choice about which between warehouse and strongbox has priority to be decreased.
      resource - is player's choice about the extra resource given.
      Returns:
      0 in standard method. this is the standard method of additionalProductionPower() which will be @Override by the specific card.
      Throws:
      InsufficientResourceException
      NoSuchProductionPowerException

    • decreaseProductionPowerResources

      public void decreaseProductionPowerResources​(Warehouse w, Strongbox s, int choice) throws InsufficientResourceException, NoSuchProductionPowerException
      Parameters:
      w - is player's warehouse.
      s - is player's strongbox.
      choice - is player's choice about which between warehouse and strongbox has priority to be decreased.
      Throws:
      InsufficientResourceException - if player has not enough resources. this is the standard method of decreaseProductionPowerResources() which will be @Override by the specific card.
      NoSuchProductionPowerException

    • whiteConversion

      public boolean whiteConversion()
      Returns:
      false in standard method. this is the standard method of whiteConversion() which will be @Override by the specific card.

    • discount

      public boolean discount​(DevelopmentCard card)
      Parameters:
      card - is DevelopmentCard to be decreased by 1.
      Returns:
      false in standard method. this is the standard method of discount() which will be @Override by the specific card.

    • recount

      public void recount​(DevelopmentCard card)
      Parameters:
      card - is DevelopmentCard to be increased by 1. this is the standard method of recount() which will be @Override by the specific card.

      CLI representation of Leader Card.
